top_categories.workout_context: Rooted Vermont rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Rooted Vermont’s vermont mountains, rolling to mountainous gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Rooted Vermont when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Racing Rooted Vermont isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rooted Vermont. Make this intensity feel like home.
Rooted Vermont’s vermont rolling to mountainous gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Rooted Vermont’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Rooted Vermont — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Rooted Vermont’s vermont rolling to mountainous gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Rooted Vermont — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Rooted Vermont — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on vermont rolling to mountainous gravel.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Rooted Vermont’s vermont rolling to mountainous gravel delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Rooted Vermont’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Rooted Vermont requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on vermont rolling to mountainous gravel to build confidence. Expect: vermont mountains, rolling to mountainous gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 75 miles of vermont rolling to mountainous gravel in Morrisville, Vermont.
